datafield.subfield: Martin Luther King Holiday Commission Records
The D.C and Federal Holiday Commissions worked to get a federal holiday for Dr. King and publicized efforts to celebrate his accomplishments.

Professor Brady Tyson donated papers related to his participation in the D.C. and Federal Holiday Commissions. Dr. Tyson was also a member of the board of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

The papers consists of memoranda, meeting minutes, reports, press releases, statements, newsletters, clippings, conference packets, and correspondence which document efforts to establish a Martin Luther King Memorial holiday The collection also includes the SCLC national magazine, and SCLC convention materials (1980s), items from the King Center in Atlanta, and some historical flyers, publications, and other historical items.
